edu.rit.pjmr

Class Customizer<K,V extends Vbl>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pjmr.Customizer<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Mapper output key data type.
    V - Mapper output value data type; must implement interface Vbl.

    public class Customizer<K,V extends Vbl>
extends Object
    Class Customizer is the base class for a customizer in the Parallel Java Map Reduce Framework. See class PjmrJob for further information about configuring customizers as part of a PJMR job.

    A MapperTask calls a customizer's methods as follows:

    1. The mapper task calls the customizer's start() method, in a single thread, before running the Mappers. The arguments are the customizer's argument strings if any, and the Combiner that will accumulate the mappers' results. The start() method may initialize the customizer based on the argument strings. The start() method may do preprocessing operations on the combiner.

    2. The mapper task calls the customizer's finish() method, in a single thread, after all the Mappers have finished. The argument is the Combiner. The finish() method may do postprocessing operations on the combiner.

    A ReducerTask calls a customizer's methods as follows:

    1. The reducer task calls the customizer's start() method, in a single thread, before running the Reducers. The arguments are the customizer's argument strings if any, and the Combiner that contains all the mappers' results. The start() method may initialize the customizer based on the argument strings. The start() method may do preprocessing operations on the combiner.

    2. If the customizer's comesBefore() method has been overridden, the reducer task sorts the combiner's (key, value) pairs, in a single thread, before running the Reducers. The reducer task calls the customizer's comesBefore() method to determine the ordering of the pairs. The reducer task passes the pairs to the Reducers in the resulting sorted order. If the customizer's comesBefore() method has not been overridden, the reducer task does not sort the combiner's pairs, and the reducer task passes the pairs to the Reducers in an unspecified order.

    3. The reducer task calls the customizer's finish() method, in a single thread, after all the Reducers have finished. The argument is the Combiner. The finish() method may do postprocessing operations on the combiner.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(String[] args,
         Combiner<K,V> combiner)
        Start this customizer.

        The base class start() method does nothing. A subclass may override the start() method to do something.

        Parameters:
        args - Array of zero or more argument strings.
        combiner - Combiner.

      • comesBefore

        public boolean comesBefore(K key_1,
                  V value_1,
                  K key_2,
                  V value_2)
        Determine if the first (key, value) pair comes before the second (key, value) pair in the desired sorted order.

        The Customizer base class does not sort the pairs. A subclass may override the comesBefore() method to sort the pairs into the desired order.

        Parameters:
        key_1 - Key from first pair.
        value_1 - Value from first pair.
        key_2 - Key from second pair.
        value_2 - Value from second pair.
        Returns:
        True if the first pair comes before the second pair, false otherwise.

      • finish

        public void finish(Combiner<K,V> combiner)
        Finish this customizer.

        The base class finish() method does nothing. A subclass may override the finish() method to do something.

        Parameters:
        combiner - Combiner.
